result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P. Hefter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt:
3:06 p.m. Defendant Michael P. Hefter in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf242 and 15cf270. Voorhees states agreement has been reached - no need for preliminary hearing in 15cf270. State moves to amend 14cf242 to misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to amend 15cf270 to ordinance disorderly conduct - Granted. Plea Questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas to both counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek statement to victim rights legistation compliance. Schiek/Voorhees/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
14CF242
Court costs $443 payment directly to Clerk of Courts
WHS/POP - 6 months
Supervision fees
Any other counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given.

15cf270
Fine - $263.50

Court informs defendant of payment plan and warrant to issue if not compliant
Adj. 3:25 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:49 p.m. Defendant Michael P. Hefter in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf270 and 14cf242. In 14cf242 - Court quashes warrant - Defendant was unaware his presence was necessary for pre-trial - thought it was between DA's and his attorney - In 15cf270 -   In receipt of complaint, Voorhees believes that PD's office will be representing in new case - waives time limits - requests prelim. Michlig/Voorhees statement to bail - Court reinstates bond in 14cf242. Court sets $ sig  bond  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

2:48 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant - Voorhees mailed copy of court record to defendant showing new court hearing date  - Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:50 pm.

4:10 p.m. Defendant Michael P. Hefter not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bednar states believes have an agreement - State needs to file Information - requests another date. Bail continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 4:12 p.m.

Defendant Michael P. Hefter in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:12
Voorhees statement - potential agreement with ADA Bednar-CLemens.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
